intro: Leucohyle, commonly known as the snow buttercup, is a flowering plant belonging to the Ranunculaceae family. It is characterized by its white, cup-shaped flowers and is native to alpine regions of the Northern Hemisphere. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, such as meadows and rocky slopes, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are simple and alternate, often with a hairy texture, while its stems are generally unbranched. The snow buttercup is an important component of alpine ecosystems, contributing to biodiversity and serving as a food source for various herbivores.
